Reviews.Title: Very poor system
Reviews.Author: video_guy
Reviews.Content: I've purchased this in a retailer store and will be returning it today. For starters, the system is poorly documented; The iPhone application constantly crashes while trying to setup the network; even when it doesn't crash, you cannot simply detect the device in your network - so it is up to you to figure out which IP address was assigned to it.You will also need to provide a Google account and your PASSWORD (wondering why that is?) to be able to use the device. I've triggered the alarm a few times just for sake of testing, and never got a single notification or image via email as I would expect. So I don't really see the point of setting up a Google account if it's never used.Photos or video taken when the alarm gets triggered will remain in the device itself - which is useless if the device itself is stolen.  Monitoring is not possible except from your local LAN/WLAN, in other words, forget about remote monitoring. Again, what is the point of having an Internet connection and a google account.Bottom line, this is a poorly conceived (or poorly executed) device, almost completely worthless.
